definition: see 咎由自取[jiu4 you2 zi4 qu3]
self/oneself/from/since/naturally/surely
to take/to get/to choose/to fetch
his/her/its/their/that/such/it (refers to sth preceding it)
fault/to blame/to punish/calamity/misfortune
to eat one's own fruit (idiom); fig. suffering the consequences of one's own action/to reap what one has sown
see 自食惡果|自食恶果[zi4 shi2 e4 guo3]
to court disaster (idiom)/to dig one's own grave
lit. to eat one's own bitter fruit (idiom)/fig. to suffer the consequences of one's own actions/to stew in one's own juice
ridiculous self-importance (idiom); arrogance
to have disastrous consequences/also written 貽害無窮|贻害无穷[yi2 hai4 wu2 qiong2]
to reject a word because of the speaker (idiom, from Analects); to judge on preference between advisers rather than the merits of the case
to keep doing evil without a sense of repentance (idiom)
to ask for trouble (idiom)/to make a rod for one's own back
lies/wild talk/to tell lies/to talk nonsense/fantasy (literature)
to spin a cocoon around oneself (idiom); enmeshed in a trap of one's own devising/hoist by his own petard
to lose one's head through material greed (idiom)
to dig one's own grave
to hand someone the swordhilt (idiom)/to give someone a hold on oneself
to tolerate is to nurture an evildoer (idiom); spare the rod and spoil the child
refrain from going to extremes in meting out punishment/not be too hard on subject
